name: Tecman rule set
description: These rules must be respected by all the AL code written within the company.

rules.justification: Only use BEGIN..END to enclose compound statements. Not interested in this warning.
Possible overflow assigning 'Text' to '*'. Not interested in this warning.
ID must be within the range 50000..99999. Not interested in this warning.
The table * does not contain the key with the field *. Not interested in this warning.
The file * has an incorrect name. The valid name is *. Not interested in this warning.
The record * should be modified before saving to the database. Hide warning until a bug is fixed in CodeCop.
Implicit conversion from Enum to Integer. Hide warning until a bug is fixed in CodeCop.
Lowering permissions should only be used in tests. Hide warning until bug is fixed in CodeCop.
The name of XXX is not valid. The name of variables and parameters must be suffixed with the type or object name. This a bad naming convention.
